title.narrative: (909.5) COMMUNCIATION FOR SOCIAL CHANGE

description.narrative: Communication for Social Change - Communication for Development (C4D) and Communication for Social Change (C4SC) is positioned as a cross-cutting and evidence-based strategy that is integral to development programmes and humanitarian work, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Cross sectoral and Development Effectiveness

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communication for Social Change - Communication for Development (C4D) and Communication for Social Change (C4SC) is positioned asa cross-cutting and evidence-based strategy that is integral to development programmes and humanitarian work

description.narrative: RO SBC continued support to strengthen evidence generation for RI, COVID-19 RCCE response and vaccine acceptance. Tools, guidance, job aids, communication assets were developed to support interventions with priority groups, including health professionals. The HealthBuddy+ chatbot reached around 500,000 users with information on COVID-19 in 20 languages. Monthly social listening reports on immunization and COVID-19 were shared with countries. Interpersonal Communication and Community Engagement capacities of health workers (15 countries) and social service workforce (8 countries) were strengthened. Cooperation with Parliamentarian, academic institutions, and interreligious networks was enhanced to advance the implementation of country programs, regional priorities and COVID-19 response. | Status:Met | As-of Date:28/02/2022
